thread.title: Kyle Schwarber's home run had the internet going crazy
thread.title_full: Kyle Schwarber's home run had the internet going crazy | Chicago Sun-Times

author: | emailAddress.indexOf('@') == -1) {errorString = 'Please enter your email address';} var isError = false; if (errorString.length > 0) isError = true; if (isError) alert(errorString); return !isError;}
title: Kyle Schwarber's home run had the internet going crazy
text:
The internet is really good at overreacting, even just to have a little fun. However, with a home run like the one Kyle Schwarber hit, it’s a little hard to overreact.
In the seventh inning, Schwarber hit a ball so far down the right field line that it ended up landing on top of the right field scoreboard.
Even with a shot of that magnitude, the internet wizards were still able to have some fun.
Kyle Schwarber killed an astronaut This is phenomenal https://t.co/27EJxO1bw5
— Stan (@Crewsett) October 14, 2015
Here is the projected landing spot of that Kyle Schwarber home run: pic.twitter.com/zIiD2AUmJS
— CBS Sports (@CBSSports) October 13, 2015
The Oakland A’s found Schwarber’s ball . @kschwarb12 's home run just landed… in Oakland. @Cubs @MLB https://t.co/62SVMxsQ9H
— Oakland Athletics (@Athletics) October 13, 2015
Schwarber’s home run nearly killed Scott Van Pelt during his highlights Sorry @BarstoolBigCat but @notthefakeSVP just took the crown for best yabo call pic.twitter.com/XDZLXikmar
— Mike S. (@BigMikeS_) October 14, 2015
Making the home run even more special, this was the second time that Schwarber called his shot. In the Wild Card game, Schwarber told team president Theo Epstein to get a kayak because he was going to hit the ball in the river. Then he did.
Tuesday night, Schwarber told center fielder Dexter Fowler he was going to hit a home run against the Cardinals pitcher. Then that happened.
